intro: Haastia recurva var. recurva, commonly known as the Maori flax, is a unique New Zealand native plant belonging to the Asphodelaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and long, narrow leaves that are often blue-green in color. The plant produces striking purple or pink flower spikes that can reach several meters in height. It thrives in coastal environments and is well adapted to the harsh conditions of New Zealand’s climate. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
